[[Image:VMware Workstation - Snapshot Manager.png|thumb|right|200px|The Snapshot Manager in VMware Workstation 6]]
'''VMware Workstation''' is a [[virtual machine]] software suite for [[x86]] and [[x86-64]] computers from [[VMware]], previously a division of [[EMC Corporation]]. This software suite allows users to set up multiple x86 and x86-64 virtual computers and to use one or more of these virtual machines simultaneously with the hosting [[operating system]]. Each virtual machine instance can execute its own guest operating system, such as [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]], [[BSD|BSD variants]], or others. In simple terms, VMware Workstation allows one physical machine to run multiple operating systems simultaneously. Other VMware products help manage or migrate VMware virtual machines across multiple host-machines.
'''VMware Workstation''' is a [[virtual machine]] software suite for [[x86]] and [[x86-64]] computers from [[VMware]], previously a division of [[EMC Corporation]]. This software suite allows users to set up multiple x86 and x86-64 virtual computers and to use one or more of these virtual machines simultaneously with the hosting [[operating system]]. Each virtual machine instance can execute its own guest operating system, such as [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]], [[BSD|BSD variants]], or others. In simple terms, VMware Workstation allows one physical machine to run multiple operating systems simultaneously. Other VMware products help manage or migrate VMware virtual machines across multiple host-machines.
